alert.note: Alert for Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 04 at 9:37PM EDT until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Northeast Cape Fear River Near Burgaw affecting Pender County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Little Pee Dee River At Galivants Ferry affecting Horry and Marion Counties. Waccamaw River At Conway affecting Horry County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Carolina... Lumber River 1 SE Nichols affecting Horry, Marion and Dillon Counties. For the Northeast Cape Fear River...including Burgaw...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Little Pee Dee River...including Galivants Ferry...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Waccamaw River...including Aiw At old Hwy 544 At Socastee, Conway, Above Conway, Freeland, Longs...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Waccamaw River at Conway. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding worsens in Lees Landing, Riverfront South, Pitch Landing, and Savannah Bluff and along Waccamaw CIR, Gray Oak DR, Riverside DR, Black Moss DR, Cypress Flat Court, Depot RD, New RD, and Jackson Bluff RD. Some of these areas may be inaccessible via road. Old Reaves Ferry RD may begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EDT Monday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and continue rising to 13.0 feet Saturday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by this evening.
